xxl.core.collections.queues.io

Class FileStackQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.collections.queues.AbstractQueue
      • xxl.core.collections.queues.io.FileStackQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LIFOQueue, Queue

    public class FileStackQueue
extends AbstractQueue
implements LIFOQueue
    This class provides an implementation of the Queue interface with a LIFO (last in, first out) strategy that internally uses a file for storing its elements. It implements the peek method.

    Example usage (1). 

         // create a new file
 
     File file = new File("file.dat");

     // create a new file stack queue with ...

     FileStackQueue queue = new FileStackQueue(
     // the created file
     
          file,
     
     // an integer converter

          IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE
      );

     // open the queue

     queue.open();

     // create an iteration over the Integer between 0 and 19

     Cursor cursor = new Enumerator(20);

     // insert all elements of the given iterator

     for (; cursor.hasNext(); queue.enqueue(cursor.next()));

     // print all elements of the queue
 
     while (!queue.isEmpty())
          System.out.println(queue.dequeue());

     System.out.println();
 
     // close open queue and cursor after use

     queue.close();
     cursor.close();

     // delete the file

     file.delete();
    See Also:
    Queue, AbstractQueue, LIFOQueue, File, RandomAccessFile

    • Field Detail

      • FACTORY_METHOD

        public static final Function<Object,FileStackQueue> FACTORY_METHOD
        A factory method to create a new FileStackQueue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). In contradiction to the contract in Queue it may only be invoked with a parameter list (for further details see Function) of objects. The parameter list will be used for initializing the file stack queue by calling the constructor FileStackQueue((File) list.get(0), (Function) list.get(1)).
        See Also:
        Function

      • file

        protected File file
        The file is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.

      • openFile

        protected Function openFile
        A function that implements the functionality of opening the file for random access. The function is invoked with file when this file stack queue is opened and must implement all the functionality that is needed to open a file for random access. When being invoked the function must return a RandomAccessFile. The function determines whether the queue uses objects that are stored in the file before calling a constructor of FileStackQueue as initial elements of the queue. E.g. when setting the length of the RandomAccessFile to 0 before returning it, objects that are stored in the file are removed.

      • converter

        protected Converter converter
        A converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of this queue.

      • randomAccessFile

        protected RandomAccessFile randomAccessFile
        A random access file stream for reading from and writing to file. The stream is created by invoking openFile with file when the file stack queue is opened.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileStackQueue

        public FileStackQueue(File file,
                      Function openFile,
                      Converter converter)
        Constructs a queue that store its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the function openFile is invoked with the file in order to open it for random access. Whether objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue or not depends on openFile. The specified converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.
        Parameters:
        file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
        openFile - a function that is invoked with the file in order to open it for random access.
        converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.

      • FileStackQueue

        public FileStackQueue(File file,
                      Converter converter)
        Constructs a queue that stores its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the file is opened for random access by calling the constructor RandomAccessFile(file, "rw"). Therefore objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue. The specified converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.
        Parameters:
        file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
        converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.

      • FileStackQueue

        public FileStackQueue(File file,
                      Function openFile,
                      Converter converter,
                      Function newObject)
        Constructs a queue that stores its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the function openFile is invoked with the file in order to open it for random access. Whether objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue or not depends on openFile. The given converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue and the specified factory method is used for initializing these elements before the file is read out.
        This constructor is equivalent to the call of FileStackQueue(file, openFile, new UniformConverter(converter, newObject)).
        Parameters:
        file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
        openFile - a function that is invoked with the file in order to open it for random access.
        converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.
        newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the file is read out.

      • FileStackQueue

        public FileStackQueue(File file,
                      Converter converter,
                      Function newObject)
        Constructs a queue that stores its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the file is opened for random access by calling the constructor RandomAccessFile(file, "rw"). Therefore objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue. The given converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue and the specified factory method is used for initializing these elements before the file is read out.
        This constructor is equivalent to the call of FileStackQueue(file, new UniformConverter(converter, newObject)).
        Parameters:
        file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
        converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.
        newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the file is read out.

      • FileStackQueue

        public FileStackQueue(File file,
                      Function openFile,
                      Function newObject)
        Constructs a queue that stores its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the function openFile is invoked with the the file in order to open it for random access. Whether objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue or not depends on openFile. A convertable converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue and the specified factory method is used for initializing these elements before the file is read out.
        This constructor is equivalent to the call of FileStackQueue(file, openFile, ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, newObject).
        Parameters:
        file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
        openFile - a function that is invoked with the file in order to open it for random access.
        newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the file is read out.
        See Also:
        ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE

      • FileStackQueue

        public FileStackQueue(File file,
                      Function newObject)
        Constructs a queue that stores its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the file is opened for random access by calling the constructor RandomAccessFile(file, "rw"). Therefore objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue. A convertable converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue and the specified factory method is used for initializing these elements before the file is read out.
        This constructor is equivalent to the call of FileStackQueue(file, ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, newObject).
        Parameters:
        file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
        newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the file is read out.
        See Also:
        ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open()
        Opens the file stack queue for the access to elements of this queue. This method is called implicitly every time the elements of the queue are accessed. This implementation checks whether a random access file stream already exists. When no such stream exists, openFile is invoked with file and the elements that are stored in the file after opening it for random access are used as initial elements of the queue.
        Specified by:
        open in interface Queue
        Overrides:
        open in class AbstractQueue

      • enqueueObject

        protected void enqueueObject(Object object)
        Appends the specified element to the end of this queue.
        This implementation opens the queue first. Thereafter the object and the size of its serialization are written to the file.
        Specified by:
        enqueueObject in class AbstractQueue
        Parameters:
        object - element to be appended to the end of this queue.

      • peekObject

        protected Object peekObject()
        Returns the next element in the queue without removing it.
        This implementation opens the queue first. Thereafter the length of the serialized object and the object itself are read out of the file and the object is returned.
        Specified by:
        peekObject in class AbstractQueue
        Returns:
        the next element in the queue.

      • dequeueObject

        protected Object dequeueObject()
        Returns the next element in the queue.
        This implementation opens the queue first. Thereafter the length of the serialized object and the object itself are read out of the file. At last, the file is truncated to its new length (the length of the file without the serialized object) and the object is returned.
        Specified by:
        dequeueObject in class AbstractQueue
        Returns:
        the next element in the queue.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
        This implementation opens the queue first. Thereafter the length of the random access file and size are set to 0.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface Queue
        Overrides:
        clear in class AbstractQueue

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this queue and releases any system resources associated with it. This operation is idempotent, i.e., multiple calls of this method takes the same effect as a single call.
        This implementation closes the random access file and deletes the file, when it is empty. Therefore the file stack queue can be reopened later and will have the same state as before closing it, when openFile does not affect the elements stored in the file.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Queue
        Overrides:
        close in class AbstractQueue
